definitions.definition: (of a thing) Having a low temperature.
definitions.example: A cold wind whistled through the trees.

definitions.definition: (of the weather) Causing the air to be cold.
definitions.example: The forecast is that it will be very cold today.

definitions.definition: (of a person or animal) Feeling the sensation of coldness, especially to the point of discomfort.
definitions.example: She was so cold she was shivering.

definitions.definition: Unfriendly, emotionally distant or unfeeling.
definitions.example: She shot me a cold glance before turning her back.

definitions.definition: Dispassionate, not prejudiced or partisan, impartial.
definitions.example: He's a nice guy, but the cold facts say we should fire him.

definitions.definition: Completely unprepared; without introduction.
definitions.example: He was assigned cold calls for the first three months.

definitions.definition: Unconscious or deeply asleep; deprived of the metaphorical heat associated with life or consciousness.
definitions.example: After one more beer he passed out cold.

definitions.definition: (usually with "have" or "know" transitively) Perfectly, exactly, completely; by heart.
definitions.example: Keep that list in front of you, or memorize it cold.

definitions.definition: (usually with "have" transitively) Cornered, done for.
definitions.example: Criminal interrogation. Initially they will dream up explanations faster than you could ever do so, but when they become fatigued, often they will acknowledge that you have them cold.

definitions.definition: Not pungent or acrid.
Unexciting; dull; uninteresting.
Affecting the sense of smell (as of hunting dogs) only feebly; having lost its odour.
Not sensitive; not acute.
Distant; said, in the game of hunting for some object, of a seeker remote from the thing concealed. Compare warm and hot.
definitions.example: You're cold … getting warmer … hot! You've found it!

definitions.definition: Having a bluish effect; not warm in colour.
Rarely used or accessed, and thus able to be relegated to slower storage.
Without compassion; heartless; ruthless
definitions.example: I can't believe she said that...that was cold!

definitions.definition: A condition of low temperature.
definitions.example: Come in, out of the cold.

definitions.definition: (with 'the') A harsh place; a place of abandonment.
definitions.example: The former politician was left out in the cold after his friends deserted him.

definitions.definition: A common, usually harmless, viral illness, usually with congestion of the nasal passages and sometimes fever.
definitions.example: I caught a miserable cold and had to stay home for a week

definitions.definition: Rheum, sleepy dust
While at low temperature.
Without preparation.
definitions.example: The speaker went in cold and floundered for a topic.

definitions.definition: With finality.
In a cold, frank, or realistically honest manner.
